TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BinaryReader extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

summary.span: Reads primitive data types as binary values in a specific encoding.

span.span: Reads primitive data types as binary values in a specific encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供了简化从流读取基元数据类型的方法。The class provides methods that simplify reading primitive data types from a stream. 例如，可以使用方法读取作为布尔值的下一个字节和流中的当前位置提升 1 个字节。For example, you can use the method to read the next byte as a Boolean value and advance the current position in the stream by one byte. 类包括支持不同的数据类型的读取的方法。The class includes read methods that support different data types. 当你创建的新实例类，提供要读取的流和 （可选） 指定的编码类型和释放后是否将流保留为打开对象。When you create a new instance of the class, you provide the stream to read from, and optionally specify the type of encoding and whether to leave the stream open after disposing the object. 如果未指定编码类型，则使用 utf-8。If you do not specify an encoding type, UTF-8 is used. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用对象实现 IDisposable"一节接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示了如何存储和检索文件中的应用程序设置。The following code example demonstrates how to store and retrieve application settings in a file. [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: Exposes access to the underlying stream of the .

span.span: Exposes access to the underlying stream of the .
The underlying stream associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!CAUTION] > 使用基础流进行读取时或同时使用`BinaryReader`可能会导致数据丢失和损坏。Using the underlying stream while reading or while using the `BinaryReader` can cause data loss and corruption. 例如，可能会超过一次读取的相同的字节数、 字节数可能会跳过，或字符的读取可能会变得不可预测。For example, the same bytes might be read more than once, bytes might be skipped, or character reading might become unpredictable. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入`Double`数据写到使用内存`BinaryReader`并类的顶部类。The following code example shows how to read and write `Double` data to memory by using the `BinaryReader` and classes on top of the class. `MemoryStream` 仅读取和写入`Byte`数据。`MemoryStream` only reads and writes `Byte` data. [!code-cpp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble/CPP/rwdouble.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble/CS/rwdouble.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWDouble/VB/rwdouble.vb#1)]

summary.span: Closes the current reader and the underlying stream.

span.span: Closes the current reader and the underlying stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此实现`Close`调用方法并传递`true`值。This implementation of `Close` calls the method passing a `true` value. 除非显式调用，刷新该流不会刷新其基础编码器或`Close`。Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call or `Close`. 设置到`true`意味着数据从缓冲区刷新到流中，但编码器状态不会进行刷新。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 这将允许编码器，以便它可以正确编码的字符的下一步块保持其状态 （部分字符）。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 这种情况下会影响 UTF8，UTF7 其中某些字符仅后才能进行编码的编码器收到的相邻字符。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters.

span.span: Releases the resources used by the class.

Public Sub Dispose ()

summary.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

span.span: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 在调用`Dispose`，必须释放对所有引用这样垃圾回收器才能收回内存的占用。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)并[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 `Finalize` 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's `Finalize` method.

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法`Dispose`和。This method is called by `Dispose` and . 默认情况下，此方法指定`disposing`参数作为`true`。By default, this method specifies the `disposing` parameter as `true`. 指定`disposing`参数作为`false`。 specifies the `disposing` parameter as `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 `Dispose` 方法。This method invokes the `Dispose` method of each referenced object.

span.para: 可以多次调用由其他对象。重写此方法时, 请小心不要引用已经释放的早期调用中的对象。有关如何实现此方法的详细信息，请参阅 [实现 Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。有关详细信息和，请参阅 [清理了非托管 Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding this method, be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement this method, see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在读取失败后，不会还原的文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何读取和写入将内存用作后备存储的数据。The following example shows how to read and write data using memory as a backing store. 本示例向控制台显示无效的文件路径字符的列表。This example displays a list of invalid file path characters to the console. 尽管该代码尝试显示无效的文件路径的所有字符的列表，但并非所有字符都可显示集内的字符。Although the code tries to display a list of all invalid file path characters, not all of the characters are within the displayable set of characters. 因为无效字符列表可以因系统上，此代码的输出可能也会有所不同。Because the list of invalid characters can vary based on the system, output for this code may also vary. [!code-cpp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2/CPP/rwreadchar.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2/CS/rwreadchar.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWChar2/VB/rwreadchar.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 读取操作失败后，不会还原的文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read operation. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何通过使用内存作为后备存储编写的二进制数据。The following example shows how to write binary data by using memory as a backing store. 它显示一条消息，指示数据是否已正确写入控制台。It displays a message to the console that indicates whether the data was written correctly. [!code-csharp[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2/CS/rwreadbytes.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.BinaryReaderWriter.RWBytes2/VB/rwreadbytes.vb#1)] 此示例读取文件的内容，并以 16 列格式显示每个字节的数字值。This example reads the contents of a file and displays each byte's numeric value in 16-column format. 检测到正在读取的文件的末尾时方法将返回零字节。The end of the file that is being read is detected when the method returns zero bytes. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果方法尝试读取流中的代理项字符异常将会引发和流中的位置将前进。If the method attempts to read a surrogate character in the stream an exception will be raised and the position in the stream will advance. 位置还原到之前的原始位置如果调用流是查找; 但是，如果流是不可，位置将不会更正。The position is restored to the original location before was called if the stream is seekable; however, if the stream is unseekable, the position will not be corrected. 如果代理项字符可以出现在流中，使用方法相反。If surrogate characters can be expected in the stream, use the method instead. 由于数据格式设置冲突，不建议此方法中使用以下编码：Because of data formatting conflicts, using this method with the following encodings is not recommended: - UTF-7UTF-7 - ISO-2022-JPISO-2022-JP - ISCIIISCII 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何读取和写入将内存用作后备存储的数据。The following code example shows how to read and write data using memory as a backing store. Public Overridable Function ReadUInt32 () As UInteger
public: virtual System::UInt32 ReadUInt32();

summary.span: Reads a 4-byte unsigned integer from the current stream and advances the position of the stream by four bytes.

span.span: Reads a 4-byte unsigned integer from the current stream and advances the position of the stream by four bytes.

returns.span: A 4-byte unsigned integer read from this stream.

span.span: A 4-byte unsigned integer read from this stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在读取失败后，不会还原的文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. `BinaryReader` 读取 little-endian 格式中的使用此数据类型。`BinaryReader` reads this data type in little-endian format. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

exception.span: The end of the stream is reached.

span.span: The end of the stream is reached.
The stream is closed.
An I/O error occurs.

summary.span: Reads an 8-byte unsigned integer from the current stream and advances the position of the stream by eight bytes.

span.span: An 8-byte unsigned integer read from this stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在读取失败后，不会还原的文件位置。 does not restore the file position after an unsuccessful read. `BinaryReader` 读取 little-endian 格式中的使用此数据类型。`BinaryReader` reads this data type in little-endian format. 通用 I/O 任务的列表，请参阅[通用 I/O 任务](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common I/O tasks, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

exception.span: The end of the stream is reached.

span.span: The end of the stream is reached.
An I/O error occurs.
